text: Coffee is so good! I'm not much of a coffee drinker but there are items on the menu that can cater to anyone. The food is really good and delicious. At the counter was a girl named May, she is awesome and super friendly and will help you order properly.

If you read my other three reviews of coffee-houses in the downtown area you will understand why I was dubious trying the new Vesta coffee-house. Well, they got everything right. 

The atmosphere is unpretentious and modern. The staff is pleasant and happy. The prices are fair. The food I had was yummy. The coffee is very good, and, yes (believe it of not) they allow you to add the sweetener yourself.  There was none of that "we can do it better than you" attitude like at PublicUs or that "we tell you where to sit" shtick you get at Makers and Finders. 

There are two things that would make Vesta even better: a social loungy area and evening hours.
highly recommend coming here for coffee and all the snacks. the coffee is incredible, and all the food is awesome. definitely can't wait to come back to vegas and try everything else on the menu!

I came here one week ago. The woman who took my order refused to pour my coffee in my reusable cup instead the plastic cup. Very disappointed about that, I didn't take anything and I won't come back anymore. I try to be zero waste and I don't understand why the y refused my cup. So sad, people don't support zero waste efforts... Especially new place like that.

I wanted to take an ice coffee and not hot coffee. And all your ice beverages are server in plastic cup. That's why I came with my sainless steel cup but the woman refused it.

Latte tasted awful. Over priced. 

Food okay but small and overpriced. 

Pretty boring and ugly place. If you thought it's so awesome and unique then you're trying too hard. Just go to Starbucks.
This place has excellent atmosphere, friendly staff and roasts their own coffee beans!  Less pretensious than Makers and Finders or Public US. Go here for something a step above your usual Starbucks!

Seriously the best!!! 
We walked in and immediately we were greeted with a very cheerful "hello" :-) the staff was so helpful and accommodating. I ordered a golden milk, which was just what I needed...so creamy and delicious! Also healthy...which was the bonus! 
I wanted to try their coffee, which they roast IN HOUSE, so I also ordered a macchiato with almond milk...it had such great flavor and a smooth texture...I noticed, later, on the menu that they have in house macadamia-almond milk...which I can't wait to try next time I visit Vegas, from Seattle. I can't wait for Vesta to (hopefully) open up a second location on the strip :-)

First time visiting Vesta today.  Beautifully designed space, very clean, super friendly and knowledgeable staff and amazing coffee and food.  Tried the almond milk latte and avocado toast with poached egg.  I'd highly recommend both.  Apparently the almond milk is homemade which I've never seen at a coffee house.  Will definitely be back.

Love the style of this coffee shop!

ATMOSPHERE: There is plenty of seating. Some of the staff are very quiet and shy while others are super friendly and engaging. It has tons of free parking which is rare for downtown Las Vegas nowadays. I find this coffee shop a great meeting place.

DRINKS: Not gonna lie, they have really different coffee options compared to other coffee shops, but I'm not a fan of how they brew their drinks. I perfer to have one of their many and delicious tea options. Everything is made with high quality ingredients. Recently, I had the Raspberry Rosemary Fresca and it was delicious!

FOOD: Really wish they had more food options. They are constantly adding new items, but their menu is still small. The croissant is flavorful and served with a cheese spread.

Well located within the Arts District of Las Vegas, Vesta Coffee Roasters is a must try. I ordered the hazelnut latte with the ham and cheese croissant. The hazelnut latte had the right balance, it was smooth and full of flavor. Too many times I get coffee that is way too acid. This was not the case at Vesta Coffee Roasters. The ham and cheese croissant had a danish look to it with the ham and cheese baked on top. The croissant was flaky and little. If you are in the area of the Arts District Vesta Coffee Roasters is a must try.

These coffee Snobs are so trendy that you won't need more than 12oz because the smell of their amazingness will be smooth to satisfy you. 

I'm a bit of a coffee snob from Washington and I've  visited roasters all over the nation. But this place annoys even me. It's the kind of shop that grimaces when you ask for vanilla in your latte and says "we don't really do flavors, but their some some syrup over there."

They try to act experienced because they roast and have a trendy space. But it reality it's an excuse to have their largest coffee be 12 oz and act like that's special because " they use 2 shots" and say we only offer one size. 

This could be a nice coffee house if the lose the pretention, serve adult size drinks and stop acting like customers are stupid when they ask for something the staff has never heard of.

Pricey hipster coffee. 3.50 for a small black drip coffee. It was a bit more acidic than I prefer and I've been drinking black coffee no cream or sweeter recently. 

It's a bright modern hipster chic coffee shop.

I finally made it over to Vesta. It's a great addition to the Arts District. There is actually parking. Woot! 

Besides an excellent cup of coffee and some good vegan food options, I really appreciate the friendly staff. Yes, I know, the other premium coffee shops tout friendliness too but everyone at Vesta's seems to be genuinely happy not corporately happy. Bonus: they are fast. A lot faster than our other coffee shop. I'd give them 5 stars but I agree with other reviewers that Vesta needs just a little extra something to make them more than an ultra-clean super-friendly good coffee shop. They'll get there, I'm sure. In the meantime I'll still be stopping in for my coffee fix.

Oh and they roast their own beans and you can watch. How geeky fun is that?
Amazing Coffee shop with lots of drink options, I tried there cortado and pour over both drinks perfect just made right. Would definitely recommend to any Coffee lovers.
My new favorite coffee place. We've tried the Eun's addiction, flynn, walter white and the heisenberg. I loved everything!! Will recommend this place to everyone!

What city did I just walk into?!?! This place is doing such great things for the coffee community!! Holy crap this place is phenomenal. 

I sat at the bar and spoke to the baristas while tasting their drip and a cold brew. They were all so incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. 

These are some of the most diverse coffee profiles I've had at one place. The cold and the hot coffees were COMPLETELY different, the cold with a honey processed Ethiopia and Costa Rica (WHAT?!) and the hot was a straight shot of Guatemala. Wowie. 

I've been to over a hundred quality coffee shops in the world and this might be in the top 5. 

Please please keep them open!!!

Love love love this place. Coffee is great! This place is my number one coffee spot so far. I have yet to try their food here. I came here twice with a friend. The first time was to meet up and chit chat. The second time we spent most of the day here looking for employment. The staff are great very friendly. It is out of my way but I would definitely drive here for their coffee!!

We were visiting Vegas and wanted to get out of the touristy area and find a good coffee shop to relax at off the strip. It's a great location for that. 

This place has an entirely different vibe than what we had seen in the rest of Vegas. Really hip and relaxed. Not touristy at all (and I hope it stays that way). 

The staff was super chill and friendly. I had the Sweet Dreams Toast and a Hazenut Latte, husband had Egg and Cheese sandwich and a pour over. We were both really pleased with our food and coffee. 

Only down side would be that the drinks were really, really small. 

But this place was a really good find and a cool place to hang out at. Will definitely be back next time we're in town!

I love the vibe the look the staff the coffee and the food. Parking was easy. Plenary of seating and the staff is so friendly. I will be back every day when I'm in Vegas. Thank you Vesta for making me feel at home during my short Vegas stay. I love the almond milk latte and the basic avocado toast and egg

This is probably one of my favorite coffee shops in Las Vegas. This coffee shop is very chic & modern with tons of indoor seating. The coffee is delicious & so is their different toasts. This is a great atmosphere for studying or having coffee with friends. I ordered an Iced Cortado Latte with their Milk & Honey Toast. Definitely recommend! 
Atmosphere- 5/5
Coffee- 5/5
Customer Service- 5/5

I accidentally ended up in Vegas, like you do. With a motel in the Arts District I spent most of my morning researching best coffee in the area. Whilst my best mate sleeps of her SXSW hangover (she came to Vegas to rest) I venture to Vesta Coffee. 

With a fabulous Latte, I ate The Basic Tartine Toast with a poached egg. Relieved it was not your traditional American eye-ball-full size, more like a Australian clean brekky style.

The interiors were stylish, inline with most Artisian coffee shops around the world. 

Grab yourself some in-house roasted beans and support the business. Its an amazing to have coffee like this in a town known for excess!

There are a few coffee places around the Arts District (and Downtown) that just don't cut the mustard. 

Vesta does. If I refer to this place as "Vespa" when you are around me, I apologize, but thats what I call it :D

The shining star here for me is an unsweetened macadamia nut mylk latte. It's amazing.

Second place award goes to unsweetened matcha latte sub out the milk with the macadamia nut mylk and call it a day. 

Their pour overs and coffee and nitro is simply amazing. The Donut Bar even carries their coffee!

Support a local roaster and buy local.

The service is outstanding and the owner is always in to greet you. Toast and sando menu is small and I think they should keep it that way.

Clean and open the place is usually packed. Not sure why people think this is hipster and overpriced. This is not a chain and fresh, quality, local ingredients represent.

If you are coming here to look for $2 coffee, skip everyone the waste of time with your "its overpriced" reviews. Move along because there is nothing to see here :D

Macadamia Nut Latte, Matcha Latte and two bomb ass The Basic avocado toasts will run you about $30 before tip. There is your warning :D 

Quality vs quantity...it wins every time!

Visiting Las Vegas for the weekend we decided to venture out for breakfast and happened to park right outside Vesta. The glass panels gave a great view from outside and we immediately knew this place was worth a visit for coffee so returned the following day.

Inside it's spacious and seating is comfortable. There are several options for seating from small tables (that can easily be grouped if you have more than a few people) to a long bar across the front window and the smaller bar seating where you can stare at the friendly people making coffee. 

Everything in Vesta appears to be new, and either wood, concrete, or white porcelain. Very chic and simple decor theme. Surprisingly thoughtful inclusion of sound damping on the ceiling means that the otherwise mostly-concrete interior is still quiet enough for conversation without having to strain your ears or increase speaking volume to compete with others. And - the chairs have rubber feet. Attention to detail matters - thanks to the interior designer of Vesta!

The menu has a bunch of creative chai-like and high-end coffee selections, and I found great explanations were available to help us decide what to get. Amazing beverages were served in nice cups. This place is definitely keeping things in the high-end bracket on every front.

There was a mix of young and old here. Some working on laptops, most just having conversations. One group had put their coffees on the floor and was taking photos - I have no idea wtf that was about but I guess it takes all sorts.

Bathrooms were really nice too. 

Parking was easy, this area has plenty of free spots right outside or no more than a minute walk away. 

Soooo... why not 5 stars? No water station and no outside seating. I've always found great convenience in being able to fill up a water glass. Not sure if that omission is a local thing, but I missed it. I had to ask twice before being able to get water. The weather today was perfect for sitting outside, but their are no tables or chairs on the sidewalk here. This is a tiny nit-pick though as the service and everything else about this place was actually outstanding in every other interaction.

Definitely go here. Try the golden milk!
Wow! We found this place by mistake looking for a cup of mud before we made our way back to Cali. They rocked out our order with a touch of Vesta! Coffee was great and the service was even better!

Hands down one of the best lattes I've had in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is very cool to sit and enjoy their fantastic coffee from here. The staff is great as well. I will definitely be a regular here. Can't wait to be back. The Macadamia Latte was amazing! Try it!
Loooooove! I had a delicious egg salad sandwich and latte. Loved the ambiance! I was able to study and enjoy my food. I'll definitely come back again a and again!
Whoa. This place is amazing. You can feel the love in the attention to detail to the drinks here. Big ups!

Stopped in at Vesta last weekend for some coffee and bites before downtown shopping in the antique stores. The breakfast tacos were excellent! Perfectly flavored and the corn tortillas tasted very fresh.

I tried the Macadamia vanilla latte. I was good, and I think I'll try a black coffee next time so I can really see what the coffee is like.
Vegas. This is your coffee spot. Congratulations. No show up and support it. You want this place to stick around!
Awesome food and atmosphere. Glad we stopped on our way out of the city. Nitro coffee was amazing!

Great atmosphere and friendly staff. It took me forever to check this place out though bc they have very limited hours (8am-4pm which is the same time I work). The coffee was good, but I definitely prefer Makers & Finders (which is just around the corner), but the service was much better here.

Super cute place to get some yummy coffee and meet with some clients! I ordered the Hawaiian Benedict Sandwich and was very happy I did. If you are in the neighborhood, you should definitely check this place out.

Barebones urban chic, that describes Vesta. Someone took a garage, swept it out, installed some clean concrete, real wood countertops, large roasters and street-view windows, and thus opened a coffee shop.

Their location is primo, settled into another side-street of the arts district. By virtue of that, Vesta (though new) already attracts a steady stream of the ilk who flock to First Fridays or who are permanent residents of the neglected and oft forgotten Las Vegas arts scene. That's right: Vesta is a good fit for anyone wanting a quick cup, but especially those young 20/30-somethings who are in search of a "coffee hangout" in this part of town more than they are a "coffee experience."

I had a macchiato, which though somewhat petit, was well-crafted, not bitter. Accompanying was a bowl of their soup of the day, a carrot ginger, just what my congested sinuses needed. Due to the latter, I can't comment much on the taste, but the texture and temperature were right on, ready for dipping the included bread sides. 
On said bread, the melted cheese was somewhat unappealing, its bright orange hue overpowering the muted color of the soup. If I souped here again, I'd ask for toast plain. 

There are no creature comforts or unique styles here that make Vesta remarkable, but the prices are right, the location key, the interior sparse but clean, and the taste of the things is fine. They make an effort to remember your name on the first visit which is neighborly, but you must collect your own food and drink when it's ready. There's no pastry display, so if you want a plain croissant, for example, you must order a croissant-meal from the menu. Thankfully, you can get one for $4.

So, a-ok overall. It just needs an ounce of character injected, or a little extra je ne sais quoi to ensure people make them a habit. Until then, I'll be back on a First Friday when in need of a quality grab-n-go.

This is hipster-ass coffee, nestled in the Vegas arts district. They roast on-site, offer a small range of solid breakfast and lunch foods, and have straightforward and knowledgeable staff. Vesta seems to fit in well despite having another coffeeshop just a block away.

Their lattes are okay, but their regular coffees and pour overs are more their forte. The breakfast croissant is huge, flaky, and nicely seasoned like an everything-flavored bagel. I like that their fromage blanc (and other menu items) is made in house but wish it had a touch more flavor and portion. The avocado toast is decent, but better with the added egg. Chia pudding is a pretty solid version too, with fresh fruit and lots of flavor.

The location is bare and minimalist. I wish there were a bit more decor but I guess they're going for the modern big-city coffee shop look, which is fine. You almost forget you're in Vegas. Bonus star for having a free adjacent parking lot!

First time here and the best coffee shop in town , absolutely great atmosphere and customer service , this is a great addition to the Las Vegas Downtown arts district , if you have not been here your missing out !

As a coffee lover I love the fact that they roast their own coffee beans. I took one sip and I could instantly tell that their coffee beans were fresh. 
The inside is specious and the staff is amazing.
Best coffee shop in Vegas. Hipster but friendly. I had the cortado and it was perfectly smooth. The coffee flavor was delicious! If you can get off the Strip, I definitely recommend it!

The Place:
The place looks cool...industrial, hip, eclectic ambiance. 

The food/pricing:
I ordered Hawaiian Benedict Sandwich ($7), a bit spicy but it's good. Drip coffee for $3.23. Fair value pricing.

Ordering:
You have to order at the counter including the food offering. They only have a menu on the clipboard by the cashier/counter. It's hard to make a decision especially when you already infront of the cashier and not knowing anything on the menu.

The staff:
They're friendly amongst themselves and seems enjoyed working here but they could have more interactive and friendlier with the customers. 

Overall:
The place is alright. Will I come back? Only if I happened to be in the area and need a dose of caffeine.

I love exploring local coffee shops all over the valley. I had a San Jose Poacquil-Guatemala pour over and their Truffle Crossiant with over easy egg---yummylicious! I like the idea that they roast their own beans and you can also buy a bag or do pour overs as well. 
The place has an urban coffee shop vibe in the artsy part of Downtown Las Vegas. I like the open floor plan layout with rustic and country feel of the place. 
I'm giving it a 5 start because for me not to use creamer and sugar for my coffee means that the quality of the beans and how it was roasted was on point. Thanks for a wonderful coffee experience guys!
Great coffee and concept. Service was friendly and coffee was great!  Busy and cozy place.

What a great little place! I can't speak to the quality of their coffee, since I had the green tea late, and my daughter had their turmeric tea, but we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and basked in tea and sandwiches that were very made. It makes total sense that this a locals fav spot. I look forward to coming back!

This is an update on the coffee. I purchased a bag of the Goose Bumps and the Peru Amaybamba roasts. They smelled as their flavor profiles described, but they tasted bitter and astringent. I slightly favored the Amaybamba. I then taste tested them alongside Starbucks Cafe Verona blend, French Roast, and Italian Roast. The Starbucks beans were superior in flavor, body, and overall Satisfaction. It could be that the beans haven't had a chance to mellow, but the cup produced by both Vesta brands under the same exact conditions (Vaccum press, 30 grams of beans, 250 ml water at 190) were inferior flavor to the Starbucks brands. This was disappointing as Vesta's custom roasts were exorbitantly priced compared to Starbucks (understandable, considering the scale of operations), but with lackluster results.

MY NEW FAVORITE PLACE IN VEGAS HAS FINALLY OPENED AND IT'S PRACTICALLY MY SECOND HOME.

A refreshingly open space, gorgeous soft lighting, friendly vibes, amazing coffee roasted in-house - does this sound hipster enough yet? Although Vesta has only been open for a few weeks, this dog-friendly establishment has already exceeded my expectations (mostly because adorable dogs grace my presence while I'm doing my work tbh).

Being my go-to place to work on my laptop, there are several outlets along the bar and on the walls if I ever need to charge up. Parking is not an issue since there's a lot right next to the building, but there is a lot of street parking as well. Just be weary when you're parked on the street for more than 2 hours because you may get a parking ticket if your timing is unfortunate!

What I've Had:

Three-Kings Pour Over - 5/5 // $5.50
If you need to stay up until 4AM, DRINK THIS. With a blend of 3 different origins from Ethiopia, this will surely give you the energy to get sh*t done. I'm still learning a lot about coffee, but its airy body makes it feel lighter and smoother than a regular drip. If you've never tried the pour over method and you're trying to get through your day, I highly recommend trying it.

All The Things - 5/5 // $4.00
Everything seasoned croissant w/ house-made fromage blanc (a.k.a. french-style fresh cheese). I haven't had a ton of croissants in my life, but this croissant has been the best croissant I've ever had in my entire life. Its texture was the right amount of softness and flakiness and the house-made fromage blanc paired so well with it.

Sweet Dream - 4/5 // $4.50
A simple and sweet dessert of nutella, almonds, coconut, and himalayan salt on a sourdough toast. It's a lovely sweet fix from the menu, but I didn't think it was amazingly spectacular.

Sooner or later, I'll probably try everything because I'll be coming here so often. If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, the friendly staff is sure to help you!
It's okay nothing to write home about and I love coffee. We tried coffee and a mocha, not worth the price.
Great cold brew, food looked bomb, interesting and crafty menu, plus the barista was super sweet (male). I chilled and wrote in my journal for a bit. Fucking brilliant.
Good coffee. Good music. Chairs are bit uncomfortable if your sitting doing work like I was for awhile. But other than that great vibe!

The best iced coffee in town!! This coffee shop reminds me of LA, very clean and minimal with great design. Highly recommend stopping by here if you love coffee. Service is amazing everyone is super friendly!

This place is a.maz.ing! I consider myself a coffee connoisseur. I prefer black coffee pour overs or French press (I also like a good cold brew on nitro). I also like finding new local coffee roasters. Vesta did not disappoint. Really cool vibe inside the shop, plenty of seats, staff super friendly, and AMAZING coffee!! I sampled their cold brew, which was tasty... but they also had 3 Ethiopian options of pour overs. THREE! I love Ethiopian coffee, so even though it was a sweltering 100+ degrees, I went for one of the Ethiopians, which was described as having blueberry flavor notes... and oh yes it did!! Easily the best cup of coffee I've had in a long time!! (And I'm from SF, where we have a good selection of local coffee roasters!) Well done Vesta. Well done. I'll be back, and I'll buy a bag before I fly out of town.
Gem of a coffee shop. Nice staff that knows how to make quality craft coffee bev's. Long drive today. 2X cortado & honey cinnamon toast was a welcome pit stop. Will return. Worth the highway detour.
Amazing flat white for a great price (4$) & the avocado toast was one of the best I ever had!

This is a terrific place.  Not the kind of place I'd normally come to but took a chance and it's great. The lovely counter lady was extremely helpful with my order. I almost wish I loved locally, I'd come here often. Very comfortable atmosphere,  coffee is fantastic. I can't say enough good things.  Even the wifi is strong and fast! Yay!

Leaving and still hungry....lol. I wanted to try this new spot for lunch. It wasn't busy so we placed our order and got it pretty quickly. The place is trendy and the employees are nice. I got the golden milk and truffle croissant. I liked the golden milk with turmeric it was surprisingly sweet. The croissant was ok not much flavor. My friend got the macadamia nut latte and it was really bitter. She also order the Hawaiian Benedict sandwich which was good. Afterwards we looked at each other and said we were still hungry. This place is for the skinny trendsetter because this place will not help your appetite. I did really like that you can bring your own canister to put your coffee in. I just feel that there are way better coffee shops.

i was really looking forward to loving this place.  a coffee roaster in downtown vegas!?  um, yes please!

unfortunately, i was left with not much more than the bitterness from the coffee.

the coffee itself is good.  everyone's palate is different when it comes to coffee.  i personally prefer my coffee to taste a little bit deep, a lot dark, very nutty, a bit chocolaty, and very smooth.  vesta makes a coffee that's a bit more fruity, light, tart, and extremely bitter.

the hubs and i went out of our way to come here because i was so excited to have a true coffee roaster here in vegas.  when we arrived, we were immediately impressed with the space and loved the atmosphere.  we were in the middle of ordering when a very rude guy interrupted us and began a rather lengthy conversation with the cashier about his blog or whatever and she just ignored us until i spoke up and said "i'll also have..."  no apology, no nothing.  just rude.

we were a bit hungry so we ordered a couple of sandwiches.  i ordered what they call the hawaiian benedict.  and as most people know a benedict is an open faced sandwich with a poached egg and hollandaise.  my "benedict" was a regular sandwich, with an overcooked egg, undercooked spam, and some sort of weird sriracha mayo spread thing served with what i can only assume were ruffles potato chips.  and it cost $7.  sorry but i'd much rather go down the street to goodwich where i can get a crazy good sandwich for the same price.

i really wanted to love it here but i just wasn't impressed and i won't be going out of my way to come here again.

I ended up leaving with two bags of beans! That is how good this place is. Still waiting to see when they will open shop up in San Francisco *crosses fingers* Delicious coffee, relaxing ambiance, great lighting, friendly staff, and to top it off (like it couldn't get any better)...loved their food. I had the avocado toast one day and went back for an egg sandwich the next! My friends ordered different things off the menu (we basically tried allllllmost everything) and it was all so good. You can tell that a lot of love goes into everything they do here. From the coffee & food to the staff & location 5 stars for sure!
Excellent coffee shop. Tremendous coffee, croissant was great, service with a ricotta-like cheese on the side. Also happened to see Andrew Zimmern having coffee inside during my visit. Random!

Ok - parking was easy and it's clean. But if the neighborhood was safer, I would have walked over to Makers and Finders for a yummy latte instead. My $5 Ethiopian pour over tasted like dishwater! Disappointed that I don't love this place as much as everyone else.

This place is exactly what Las Vegas needs. This coffee shop has such a relaxed California vibe to it! I LOVE it. Not only are the baristas extremely nice but the coffee is incredible. They have different house made nut milks that are so delicious. It's downtown so there's a lot of cool stuff around and also there's parking!! Yay!
I went here on my lunch break as I work down the street, service was good, everyone was polite. Great tasting coffee and great location! Will be returning soon.

Was going to a different coffee shop and was circling around to find parking when I spotted Vesta out of the corner of my eye, so, decided to give them a shot as they are a roaster. Glad I went in.

Large, open, contemporary space. Roaster out in the open along with sacks of beans. Plenty of space to sit and relax with a cup.

One of the longest lists of pour over options re: bean varieties I've seen. Very nice roast, well executed pour over.

Friendly and helpful staff (one of the women working that day ran over [literally] with a napkin when she noticed I was having a minor issue).

Decent sized parking lot next to the building.

Will be making a stop anytime I am near-by. Will be buying some beans for brewing at home.
Fantastic espresso (nutty/earthy) without any gimmicks. Good milk ratios, flavors looked good but didn't try them. Comparable to LA if not SF quality.
I cannot say enough good things about this place. Amazing coffee, great food, excellent customer service and really cool people, stellar and clean coffee shop vibe and so much more.
Cool coffee shop.  Good beans with a fair trade focus.  Nice ambiance to the whole place and they brew a pretty solid espresso.

Here is a fantastic traditional cappuccino gem in Vegas! 
Service was super friendly. Clean place. Make the trip is worth it!

This place was good enough that we came twice. Tea with expertise and an excellent, yet small and well curated food selection shined for me. The space is light and airy and comfortable. It felt homey, but not too cozy. A great work space or spot to catch up with a pal. When the rays of sunshine hits you coming in the window, you feel like you're in coffee shop heaven! I recommend the ham and cheese croissant, but it's not what you're used to!

Be sure to check out the gorgeous mural on the side of the building!

Literally everything at this joint is delicious. I'm a cross-country coffee nerd, and was expecting PublicUS-quality coffee with some great snacks. Without saying which is better, I'll just say Jared & Co. nailed it. Their house nut milk makes the most balanced, crave-worthy latté ever. It's a revelation for your pal's that "aren't latté people." The sandos are compact yet hearty, and the dish I least expected to like the least I'm in love with: The overnight oats & chia. 

But the best thing about Vesta is their simple commitment to hospitality. 

The service is fast (a rarity for LV craft coffee) and always genuinely welcoming. Today we walked in [unwittingly] after closing. Alyssa noted the time, and offered to make us a round of drinks excluding the items that req'd equipment that was already powered down. No fuss. In a town where F&B often closes *before* posted hours w/ little to no regard for the guest, it's a thoroughly refreshing addition. Hopefully, they become a trendsetter in both service and fare.

Coffee that is actually roasted here in Las Vegas? Like, could we be so lucky???  The answer to that is YES!! It is probably some of the best tasting coffee spots in town.

Don't worry when you walk in and see all the MacBook laden bearded hipsters.  They don't bite and are actually kinda fun to people watch.   I'd been wanting to check this place out for some time and since we were in the neighborhood (sorta) we made a quick run in.

We only tried the iced latte's on this visit but the food on the menu looked great! Like creative and tasty.  They have a selection of flavors for your latte if you happen to be into that.  I like regular simple syrup or if I am being daring, a vanilla syrup.  The wife had some floral flavor.  She said it was "rockin".

This is a definite if your ever downtown.  Careful if you plan on parking in the lot to the side of the shop.  It was full the day we went.  We were inside for maybe 8 minutes and the parking Nazi's tagged our car.  Rightfully so as we parked where it said not to but sheesh....can a guy grab a cup of coffee?

This is exactly what the Arts District needed! A REAL coffeehouse. The coffee is roasted in-house, my tea was steeped perfectly and the egg salad sandwich is my new crack. The employees are knowledgeable and super nice, the space is open ( and can, hopefully, accommodate some comfy couches down the road ;) ), and not even a week in and it's hoppin'! Welcome to the neighborhood, and feel free to take all my money!

Highly overrated faux artiste hangout. $5 for a flimsy piece of toast with butter and sugar on top. That's what we ate between meals as children. Kid behind counter was snooty when I asked for a fork and had to return to counter yet again for real sugar for my burnt-tasting espresso. It's also one of those places that doubles as an indoor dog kennel for lonely hipsters vicariously seeking attention.

Excited for this brand new venue in DTLV/ Arts District.
 
So, I'll start with parking. We came in a Sunday & parking was easy. I believe they have a small shared lot to the south of the building but there was plenty of parking on the street.

Building/ walking through the door/ Interior design: Simple facade design & signage. Good finishes with no crazy elaboration. Very nice. As you walk in, big open space with views to the coffee roaster at the end. Industrial chic. Easy to find the register without any interior signage. No menu boards but they have paper menus at the register for ordering. There's an queue area if need be to the left of register. Love the patterned use of subway tile. Simple black/ white / warm wood design. May need a little pop of color but possibly with future artwork. Low chairs are comfortable but as a person w/ back problems, stools w/ no backs are not my thing. And I always harp restaurants/ bars should have purse hooks, especially when backless stools are provided at counters.

Service: the kids behind the counter are very friendly, nice & helpful. They welcome you as you walk in the door. They also helped me decide to order a cappuccino. 

Food: my boyfriend ordered an egg/ cheese sandwich & he said it was very good. I ordered a savory avocado tartine/ toast & it needs help!!! It has great potential but the mainstay of the toast, the avocado was NOT RIPE. It was hard & tasteless. And it was supposed to have salt (Himalayan) but I tasted none. If all the elements of the toast worked, I'd highly recommend. So if you order, ask if the avocado is ripe. 

Coffee: Delish! Albeit, because of health reasons, I drink decaf and there was none (yet, but soon I was told- #1 request from patrons). But coffee was VERY GOOD. 

All in all, not bad for food, great for coffee & atmosphere.

Came here Sunday for brunch. Street parking....there's bound to be a spot somewhere...but whether if it's close or far, that'll be based on luck.

The atmosphere had a hipster vibe. A lot of people were on their laptops or reading a book. It was quiet, staff was friendly and the place was pretty calm and chill. Natural lighting filled up the room. Tables and chairs can be difficult to get if you come during peak hours. We took the last two empty seats in the restaurant located up on the bar top.

I ordered the Hawaiian Benedict Sandwich. Came out pippin hot, fresh and flavorful. Pretty big portion too. It came with a small side of chips. Boyfriend order the sausage breakfast sandwich. He enjoyed it and honestly, I liked his a bit better. I wasn't a big fan of the over easy egg on my Hawaiian benedict sandwich...it was super runny. 

For drinks, I ordered the macadamia almond latte that everyone orders. I guess that's their specialty drink, am I right? It was alright...not sure if the caffeine is strong enough because I didn't taste any hint of it. To me, it taste like almond milk, it had a thick consistency unlike most lattes. Boyfriend got this berry hibiscus looking tea. 

I've had Vesta bookmarked for a looong time and I'm glad I was finally able to give them a try. This is really a 3 1/2 stars review. Everything was good but I much rather go to another breakfast/coffee shop close by.

The nitro coffee is amazing. I like how the staff is wonderful and remembers the patrons. This place is my favorite coffee shop. The girl that took my order is phenomenal-- I wish I can remember her name to give out a shoutout. Her customer service is exceptional.

I really enjoyed the "Aztec Mocha" and "Americano". The Aztec Mocha was over $6 with tax (size small); the "Americano" was over $5 with tax (size small). Thus, the price is a bit steep even when compared to Starbucks. For this reason I cannot afford to make Vesta an everyday coffee spot. However, the chia pudding (berry version) is very filling and moderately priced. I will return occasionally because the taste of the coffee is unique and delicious. If I could make a recommendation, it would be to implement a rewards system for loyal customers.
Great Tasting Espresso, Picture Perfect Cappuccinos clean shop with a good soundtrack. Much better baristas here than makers and finders a block away.

I found this place on yelp it popped up and hot and new and decided to give it a try???? 

I'm not a big coffee drinker but the few I have tried have been super yummy 

But I keep going back to the Hawaiian breakfast sandwich and it's AMAZING ...... the flavors are delicious if you haven't had one I suggest you try you are missing out on yummy stuff 

The parking lot next to it is free parking so take advantage:) 

Happy eating
My Macadamia Almond latte was delicious. Nice spot in a nice clean area of town. Lot of people with laptops and headphones. Staff are nice and friendly. Will stop again if I'm in the area.

I'm constantly on the lookout for a new local coffee shop in Las Vegas because they are somewhat hard to come by.  Unfortunately, this is not it. 
 I wanted to love Vesta and their hipster vibes so much especially after hearing their story and reading all the fantastic reviews on here.  They are just trying too hard to fit a mold that doesn't work for everyone.  
I wasn't feeling particularly adventurous so I ordered my favorite drink to try at a new shop, a nonfat vanilla latte.  The barista told me that they did not have nonfat milk so I asked for soy instead.  He somewhat rudely said "nope" and then asked if I drink any nut milks.  I finally settled on almond milk which was fine.  He then told me that they do not have vanilla flavor either.  I asked what they did have and he told me they only have simple syrup (nothing more than sugar/water to any coffee lover) or a cardamom simple syrup.  I asked him what was in their Macadamia-Almond latte because that was what my friend was drinking.  He was obviously getting frustrated and informed me that both the macadamia nut and almond flavors are just milks made from those nuts.  I settled on that drink which let me down severely.  Coffee, nut-milk, different nut-milk, simple syrup.  Not impressed.  I completely understand letting the coffee stand out or whatever but this drink was straight up not good; ruined by the simple syrup alone.
I am looking forward to trying Vesta again someday without any expectations or a drink already in mind.
We brought the 1yr old baby.  He had the milk and honey toast and was amazed.  That's saying a lot because he has very discerning tastes.

Love me some Vesta! I have the good fortune to be right down the road. Michelle is not only a pal but a great business owner. many folks who used to work the Beat to graduated here. The place is subdued, like a blank canvas and its very refreshing. A little Portlandia mixed with the village and southwestern minimalist. All around are artsy folk who emerge out of the crannies whenever a new coffee places come around. Yet that works. Less grit.More grown up. The americano is sublime. I love coming here!
The best coffee spot in Las Vegas! Incredible almond milk latte & avocado toast. Cool vibe and great prices!

The Arts District gets a new concrete coated black gold wonderland right off Main Street.
 
Vesta Coffee says what it does right in the title, "roasts coffee" which I rather enjoy and by the way most local places should be roasting their owner stuff or at the least buying from local roasters. The inside is a minimal and large open space with gray colors everywhere, white walls, and a slurry of millennials taking up all of the table space. 

I wasn't hungry when I showed up, but the food menu looked pretty good with things like smashed avocado toast, breakfast sandwiches and something called a  Hawaiian Benedict. I ordered a nitro cold brew, it was a tad bitter and didn't quite have that Guinness-like texture and finish that a good nitro has. 

I originally came here to get some work done before I headed to a few other meetings in the area, but the Wifi kept going in and out or was super slow. I know, "first world" problems right, but when 90% of people who come to coffee shops and plan on using the WiFi, that shit needs to be on point. 

I might have come on a bad day, but Vesta didn't do anything for me.  It's a decent stop before your final destination, but I wouldn't go out your way to try it.
Very good coffee. WiFi. Better than an avg Starbucks. Shave something before you go inside. Bring money, lots.

Not only is Vesta brewing delicious coffee, they have provided a spot downtown where people can gather comfortably. From the decor, which is tasteful and modern, to the coffee, which is house roasted and ethically sourced, Vesta is bursting with pride for what they do. Vegas isn't known for community, but Vesta is changing that.

Disclaimer: I am a caffeine addict.  I am also a bit of a coffee snob 
My morning does not feel complete without a cup of black coffee - no bullshit (aka cream & sugar to mask the subpar flavor of something like Folgers)
I was in downtown staying at a nearby hotel for the Super Bowl weekend with some family members, and I NEEDED to find a legit coffee place that preferably roasted their own beans
Enter Vesta Coffee Roasters!  They exceeded my expectations and sustainably source their coffee from all over the world
Thank you yelp gods, yet again for leading me to a quality coffee place in Las Vegas
My husband and I loved their coffee so much that we came here (no joke) three mornings in a row just to get our morning caffeine dose.
I am a fan of their pour over Guatemala roast, and my husband prefers something fruity and acidic like Kenya or an Ethiopian roast

This place is super hipster/industrial in decor, in a quiet street in downtown Las Vegas.  I also love that they offered matcha here too!  In three days, we tried three of their pour overs, nitro cold brew, the macadamia nut almond milk latte, and matcha latte.  All drinks were great!  We even took extra on our last day their because we knew we needed extra caffeine for the road driving back to San Diego.  I now know where to come next time I'm in Las Vegas.  Thanks for opening, Vesta Coffee Roasters!

Love this place. Great coffee. Laid back and clean environment. 

The Costa Rican pour over might be the best cup of coffee I've ever had. Really glad they are in the Arts District.

Amazing coffee!!! Easily one of the best new places in the area. They have an extensive menu and the staff is very friendly. They have ample light for studying. They roast their own coffee in house and the street parking is both free and convenient. Highly recommended!

Let's spend all day here reading our favorite books (or at least pretending to). Vesta is the coffee shop that I have been waiting for in Las Vegas: bright, comfy, great design and music. It's the spot with friendly faces, great coffee grounded in-house, and plenty of tables to get all that important work done on your laptop. While it's not a full-blown restaurant, they always have amazing food options including gourmet pastries, avocado toasts, sandwiches, and daily soup specials.

One of my favorite coffee spots in town.  I come down here whenever I need more espresso beans.  The coffee is great, the atmosphere is nice and the food is excellent.  If I lived closer I would definitely be down here more.

Different vibe of a spot than what is offered downtown. It seems best for those who go to a coffee shop to get work done by themselves. I like the simple design and the coffee bar seems to work well for staff. The counter service was slow and with only one order ahead of me I had to wait about 10 mins for my regular latte. When I got the latte, I didn't feel it was warm enough. Next time I will try a pour over as it seems that is more their specialty. 

Some kinks to figure out, but worth another try.

I cannot believe I have never reviewed this place, yet I come here about twice a week. This place does it right. Simplicity with quality. Sourcing their beans from the top 1% in the world really shows here.
Vesta does everything there from roasting to brewing to serving up a friendly smile. This place has their stuff together.
Staff seems to remember me which is really nice. I see most of the same employees there so I know they are happy and that speaks wonders. 
The place is always clean, i don't think I've ever seen it a mess. Very urban/hipster vibes when you walk in. They let dogs hang out there if on leashes of course. Just kind of all flows well.
I love their hot blend. It's sooooo amazing. Usually I add milk to my coffee but this is too good to add anything to. A huge flavor boost in my mouth. For me to drink it black says a lot. They have some simple food options but nothing too crazy. Just light snacks and sandwiches.
Keep it up vesta you all rock here: you know I'll be back! Clearly. 
#GenderNeutralBathroomsHere #Progression

Pretty modern looking place with a lot of people working on their computers. I came in fairly early around 8 about two weeks ago, and it looked like people had already been there a while. 

The coffee is very very strong, I could definitely feel the expresso kick in--which is rare because of my coffee addiction. The chia bowl was tasty too, but there was a spice in there throwing it off a little for me. I wish their menu was as big as Makers & Finders or PublicUS. 

Not a fan of the silverware. I don't expect fine china, but it looked/felt cheap, almost like it would give you a rash if you were allergic to the metal. The space didn't really feel cozy or inviting. It's too modern and industrial to make me want to sit down with a book with coffee. A solid choice if I just want coffee on the go.

This place is great. They roast their own beans and make a delicious cold brew. The design of the space inside was nice and seemed like a good place to stop and work for a while. Will definitely return.

I really wish this place was open later.. I love it. I tried a nitro cold brew for the first time and honestly, it was divine. And super caffeinated. The flavor is better than anything you can find at a chain. There's plenty of space for laptops and it's def got that local vibe. It's nice to see that in Vegas.. where it's often catered just to tourists. This is more hipster and local. A bit pricey, but you'd expect that.

Such a good coffee spot in the arts district. We spotted this place driving by and stopped in for a Canadian latte and a macadamia nut latte and were super impressed. So glad to see spots like this popping up in Vegas! Great work!

This is a new favorite coffee shop in downtown Vegas. The vibes are great but the coffee is some of the best you will taste in the Valley. A decent food selection too and the roasting of beans puts an amazing aroma in the shop. Great place to park yourself, get some work done and enjoy an amazing beverage.

The space is roomy and well lighted. We parked on the street since most of the parking in the lot is for other stores. The cashier was friendly and helpful when I asked about their drinks. 

I had the Matcha Green Tea Latte ($6)- half sweetened. Definitely recommend this drink! The sweetness level was perfect, and the matcha wasn't too overpowering. Clean tasting drink. 

Boyfriend had the cold brew iced ($4)- "not too bitter with a tinge of sour".

Best coffee I've found in Vegas. I like the avocado toast and the overnight oats; everything else on their menu is forgettable. But the coffee! So rich, so complex. Order a pour over and drink it black, it will change your world.

Modern and up to date atmosphere.... Young vibe.... love it. 
Rainy Sunday, decided to get some nice coffee. Concerned about parking but it was unnecessary concern. Parking lot is big. 
Had Matcha Latte and Hawaiian Benedict Sandwich. Two thumbs up. No doubt that this will be my favorite coffee / breakfast house in Vegas.

Some places are popular for a reason, other places you wonder why. This unfortunately, ranked on the latter for me. The cortado was stingingly bitter and acidic, impressive in a drink frothed with milk. Their Hawaiian Benedict had good flavors, but did they have to buy the buns at a local gas station? My ham and cheese croissant was not a croissant and the oil on it stayed with me long after I left the place.
Really excellent coffee and decent breakfast items.  The menu is simple but it's good quality stuff.

Super cute, industrial style coffee shop that sells some pastries and a small menus (soup/sandwiches) the coffees are amazing and they have different styles of coffees and teas. Great atmosphere and easy customer parking. I'll be back and would recommend to anyone.
Small menu and pricey drinks. My small iced coffee, which is comparable in size to a tall at Starbucks, was $6.50. The workers there are friendly.
Delicious Coffee for all! My son thoroughly enjoyed the nutella toast with slivered almonds & coconut chips.

this place looks great inside and the staff are very friendly!
the outside looks a little shady, and i feel like it would be hard to find parking on the peak hours. luckily my friend and i came in early. 
Great place to have coffe and study...4.5 stars*_*

Awesome coffee shop in the heart of the Arts District in Downtown LV. From the friendly baristas to delicious coffee makes this place a great place to hangout with friends or work/study. This converted garage-like space into a cafe with its modern and streamlined decor makes it appealing for all generation despite the crowd is full of Millennials and the upcoming young Generation Z.

Their Macadamia Almond Latte is simply delicious and balanced, not too sweet. The milk & honey toast was really good and was a balanced flavor of sweetness and savory. Paired well with my latte. Another noteworthy drink is the Matcha Latte, which was subtle in flavor and not watered down like other cafes.

Another cool aspect of this cafe is the in house roasting machine. Very few cafes promote locally roasted coffee beans but this particular cafe takes pride in their coffee. I would also suggest sitting at the bar, which allows a great way to watch the baristas prepare your delicious hand-crafted drink or the cook preparing a delicious meal or snack.

2017 Yelp Review #7

Great coffee spot that does not have any touristy vibe to it. It appeared that they roast their own beans in house and they do sell beans as well. Bought a few bags of it after tasting how great their coffee was. While I was there I also had a great breakfast sandwich. If you love coffee and want to escape the noise of the strip, this is for sure the spot to visit.

Recommended by Jeff V., this hipster cafe was our first stop in Las Vegas. I had read stellar reviews from my friends, Terri, Stefany, and Marlon, so this place looked legit!

When I asked Daniel about going here, he said that he was quite sure that his wife, Minky, would love the croissants...and she did!  She said that this was her favorite meal of our entire trip!

The bonuses of Vesta is the free parking lot, the convenient restroom, the fruit-infused water dispenser, and the friendly service!  The sunlight was warming up the environment, so the shade was pulled down for the customers. Daniel noted the garage door opening on the side of the large room which was converted to blend into the decor!  Cool!

Daniel and I split the Vesta Breakfast Sandwich and the Truffle Croissant Sandwich...yum!  I enjoyed the flakiness of the croissant and the heartiness of the Breakfast Sandwich. I was more hungry than thirsty, so the self-serve fruit-infused water was just right for me!

This was Minky's happy place and it set the tone for a great vacation!  Thanks to Vesta and Jeff V. for getting us off to a good start!
They roast their own drinks. Nothing better than supporting the local coffee shop.  They also provide 1 free refill (basic black coffee).

I completely agree with Vesta's origin story, that it was created out of necessity. Vegas was completely devoid of a truly great independent coffee roaster until Vesta. Vesta not only fills that void, but created a wonderful space in DTLV. The coffee shop is a vision of what all local coffee shops aspires to. I love the interior that is brightly lit with the clear panels of their garage door to the showcasing of their roaster. 

As for the coffee itself, I am blown away by how good not only their espresso is, but also their specialty lattes. The macadamia-almond latte is probably my favorite as I love nutty flavors. They show so much restraint with the sugar and syrup as the bold coffee and nutty flavors really come through first. The hazelnut latte is more subtle in flavor. I have yet to try the matcha latte, which is next on my list, but I did try the Golden Milk, which was not my cup of tea. That's not to say that it wasn't good, but I don't think turmeric drinks are ready for prime time, but I appreciate that it's on the menu for those who enjoy it. 

Another favorite of mine is their tartine toast, which goes wonderfully with their coffees. I initially was a big fan of the sweet dream, which had a wonderful balance of nutella, almonds, coconut, and Himalayan salt, but my new favorite is the milk & honey. I love the house-fromage blanc, topped with honey and cinnamon. 

Best of all in downtown LV, there's a parking lot in the back that makes going to this location an easy decision.

Awesome place! Simple, cool and modern interior with super friendly staff. Coffee is fabulous. Seriously one of the best I've had. Only wish I was in Vegas for a few more days so I could come back for more. Food was also awesome. Small to large portions with a slight and tasty twist to each. Loved it!

On vacation here and like to visit the little guy. This place was great.  My husband got an espresso and it was excellent and a great serving. I got the flat white which was perfect. The avocado toast was delicious and hit the spot with great flavor and by squeezing the lemon over the top I found a new favorite.

took my 2 kids and their dad there for father's day, since he LOVES coffee.  coffee was really good - had the guatemala coffee pour over.  but at $5 a cup, can get pricey.   kids got the ham and cheese croissant.  what came out was good, but a little too 'fancy' for them.  i had the avocado toast with poached egg.  surprisingly, the egg was under seasoned.   the kids dad got an egg breakfast sandwich. again good, but the egg was under seasoned, if seasoned at all.  
seating was my least favorite part.  the big table in the center had 2 couples, each seated one seat in, which wasted a good 4-6 seats being that we had a party of 4.  
overall coffee was good, would go back to just hang minus the kids.

Super Cute coffee joint with awesome food. I was staying at the strip and decided I needed to get out and see the area. I got the truffle breakfast sandwich was super awesome id eat that every day if I could. I got the macadamia almond latte and was a little disappointed it wasn't sweet- idk if you can get it sweet or not but I drank it non the less.
Perfect grab and go place, or even sit down and catch up with work or friends. Friendly staff and the best part, delicious coffee. Excited to see what this place turns into.

This space is if nothing else beautifully executed. And I would of course venture to this cafe again when in Vegas because although the coffee didn't move me (might have been a bad shot or perhaps the flavor profile is just a tad to bright for me)- the customer service was excellent. The man behind the counter making my avocado toast was an artist creating art. He was skilled and a pleasure to watch. And the lovely lady (from down under I believe) was thoughtful and such a delight! Well done Vegas. You are so much more than a strip.

A friend had recommended me this place & I am so glad I ventured out to give this cafe a try. Once you enter this place its a completely different vibe, almost seems as if you're in Seattle or someplace other than Vegas. The whole aesthetic of the was beyond tumblr and blogger worthy. A great place to study as there is tons of room to fit a spot to comfortably sit at and get to work. Very friendly staff. Prices are fairly high but it was such a great environment to study at I didn't really mind. The lighting inside was superb, their location sit perfectly in a spot when natural lighting lit up the entire place but wasn't blinding at all. 

I ordered a matcha latte and avocado toast. The toast was a little on the too crispy side which I dont really prefer but nevertheless it was still good. 

Highly recommend for anyone who loves a good cafe to study, read a book, or even chill at!

This is going to be one of my new coffee spots when I'm in downtown! Loved the environment and croissant ham and cheese was delicious as well as the macadamia almond latte. The only reason it wasn't 5 stars is that I had to get up three separate times for my food. They had my croissant ready first so I went and got that, than my latte was ready so went and got that, and then once I sat down I realized they didn't give me any utensils for my ham and cheese croissant so I had to go get that as well. It would be nice if either it was ready all at once or served at the table. Otherwise it was a pleasant experience overall, I will be returning.

Love this place! Great vibe and staff are really cool people. I only get to visit on the weekends which isn't a bad thing since they serve breakfast tacos only on the weekend! But, don't worry they have nice little menu everyday that looks and smells awesome, haven't tried everything...yet. Happy to have Vesta open in the neighborhood.

Great coffee shop! We live in Florida and we're visiting LV and I found this place near our hotel. Fun neighborhood, artsy and eclectic! Went two days in a row because we enjoyed the coffee and experience! Thank you!

A beautiful coffee shop. Located in the art district of downtown Las Vegas. The great thing about this place is there is a parking lot available, making it convenient to go to, and there's so much natural light. I went with the matcha tea latte! If you like it sweet, definitely ask for sweetener it it, I didn't go with sweetener and it was bitter but it was due to them using actual matcha powder. The baristas were very helpful when it came to fixing my drink which is much appreciated. They have little sandwiches and toasts to eat. Lots of seating. I can't wait to come back and try their coffee, it looks amazing!
Food here is really good.  It's a hipster type joint with good coffee and good breakfast items.  I'm here from out of town and it provides a good breakfast!

Love love loved this coffee spot! I was in serious need of a caffeine jolt and Taylor S knew just the place. This part of town seems right up my alley--lots of cool looking coffee shops, midcentury-inspired store fronts, vintage shops, etc. We were in a bit of a hurry and there was a fair amount of construction in the area, but this is a part of town I'd love to explore more.

Vesta itself is so fresh and so clean and so very hipster. White subway tiles, cool art, plants, and tatted baristas make this spot super cool. They've got an awesome drink menu with all of the classics plus some fun extras, like golden milk and hazelnut lattes. They've also got food--tartines, sandos, pastries, soup, and salad to be exact. I stuck with my go-to this time (Americano with steamed almond milk), but I love how well rounded their menu is and would definitely come back to try some other items.

Our baristas were incredibly friendly here! There were lots of people here working and taking meetings. Parking was easy, we found a spot right out front. Adore this spot!

I just wish they would stay open later. I am an afternoon coffee drinker and travel a good distance to get here. There alwaysl seems to be plenty of people here when it gets close to closing time, at least when I've been there.  Just wishin'.
Very cool place. Friendly baristas greet you in this clean and we'll lit space. The coffee is on point with a few good looking food offerings.

Great addition to downtown. I had a black coffee and shared a very delicious toast with butter and honey, both were very tasty. Seems obvious but a lot of coffee shops screw this up, coffee temperature was very good, very hot so I could enjoy it down to the last drop without having to guzzle. Very nice, open space. Great for a work meeting, plenty of seating and not too loud.

This cafe is really beautiful and has a nice airy feel. They don't have a large, extensive menu but we all know quantity does not equal quality. I ordered the flat white and my friend ordered the hazelnut latte. They were made quickly with latte art on top. If you want a drink that does not feel like it is all milk or all sugar, I highly recommend this place. They seem to have perfected the art of making coffee. 
I also decided to order the avocado toast with a poached egg and it really was the perfect size breakfast. 
If you need to come here to study or get a little bit of work done, there are plenty of outlets and seating and the music is not extraordinarily loud like so many coffee shops nowadays. 
Like previous reviews have stated, they do have a small parking lot and also street parking out front.

I really wanted to love this place because their coffee is good but they continually mess up my order and forget call in orders. The first time I went I asked for extra sauce on my sandwich and they put no sauce on my sandwich, which as a takeout order I then had to eat dry. The second time I called in a coffee so it would be ready and when I got there to pick it up she said "oh I'll put your drink in now"; why do you think I called ahead! 
The third time I called a food order in and ahead of time and when I got there they had forgotten about it and never put it in! So I went to work hungry. That's way too many times to screw up and it means you have a systemic problem.  I will be switching to Makers & Finder's as my morning coffee shop! I would post a photo but I did not receive the sandwich order I called in
Good coffee and great service. Workers are really nice. They have good conversation at checkout. Come here for coffee and to just hang out too.

In my opinion, the best Americano is a cup of dark, rich, full bodied goodness. This isn't what I found here. What I got was that sour tasting light body coffee. I'm not an expert, but my tastebuds didn't like this. My wallet didn't like the cost of approximately $3.50 for such a simple brew concoction. The ship was so minimalistic and almost sterile looking. I guess that's what some people like, but I like character, and strong, rich coffee that doesn't make my mouth pucker.

Love this contemporary coffee shop. The modern, urban look of Vesta is more common nowadays, but the quality of drink and food is not. 100% perfection. 
Arrived about 10:45/11 on a cloudy, cold Saturday with very few seats available. Spotting two free chairs at a long table occupied by Apple laptops and artfully poured lattes in ceramic mugs, my friend and I moved in to claim the only two free chairs. 
We ordered a matcha latte with a tad of simple syrup to sweeten up the heavy glassy notes of the matcha powder. A cortado was also ordered, delicious with its dark, yet creamy texture, packing a highly caffeinated punch. Two avocado toasts, one with a poached egg, sprinkled with red pepper flakes, was the perfect brunch pabulum for the lively conversation that would be our usual talkfest. 
The neighborhood of Vegas named The Arts District, is slowly trying to revamp itself into a more sophisticated, cultivated area that supports the arts, small businesses, restaurants and coffee shops. 
They have an area sectioned off towards the back where they roast coffee beans, offering bags of Vesta Beans available for sale. 
$31 for 2 drinks and 2 avo toasts. A tad pricey, but well worth it.  
Will definitely return.
The staff is really friendly and the coffee is really great. I ordered a cappuccino and it was delicious. Staff welcomed me when I walked in. Very clean with a great vibe

I'm just a tourist but it was quick & easy to catch a bus from the strip and spend a couple hours in the Arts District. The first stop was Vesta for a latte & breakfast. The espresso is legit and the simple, fresh menu was just wanted after all of the heavy food I ate the day before. It was hard to decide what to order - everything coming off of the kitchen line looked so good. I had the breakfast tacos special and was not disappointed.

This is a chill and relaxed spot. Skip the corporate coffee being peddled on the strip. House made simple syrup anlong with oat milk and other delicious concoctions to enhance their in-house roasted coffee. If your on the north strip its walkable or a short drive if you past the SLS etc. Dont settle, this place will start your morning off right.
Great coffee, strong and wonderful! The breakfast tacos (weekend special) were super tasty too. Best coffee in Vegas.

This is an amazing coffee shop! 

My boyfriend and I were in town for New Year's and needed a quick pick me up. We went here and it was a bit busy but went fast. I got the Almond Macadamia Latte which was amazing and not too sweet (strong for a latte which I like!) the macadamia left a nice nutty aftertaste! My boyfriend got the Chiapas pour over (his favorite) and he thought they did it really well! They only had small glasses so they gave him two! I got the Hawaiian breakfast sandwich to munch on and loved their creativity with the sriracha hollandaise and SPAM. I'm not stranger to SPAM and I loved seeing it on a coffee shop menu! 

Next time we're in town we'll definitely be back!

Delicious coffee and breakfast sandos. And dog friendly!  This dog mom appreciates not having to leave my girl tied up outside on a cold December morning. Love the open space concept, it is bright and clean inside. The employees are nice. Welcome to the neighborhood, Vesta!

Wonderful staff and coffee. I had wonderful service and they made a point to remember my name. :)

Food is good too. 

The fact that they roast their own beans says a lot! Definitely a place to go if your in the DTLV area.
I gave this a 3 because while the coffee was good it is very over priced for the only size they offer. $13 for 2 small coffees.

I came to Vesta after seeing some good things on Yelp and decided to give it a try. This place is a good, solid spot for getting a good cup of coffee or latte, and they offer a homemade nut milk (I think... I really can't remember) for all fellow lactose intolerant folk like me. Yeah, cappuccinos in general taste a little different when you're not using real milk, but Vesta's cappuccino tastes great and are just as satisfying as using steamed milk. 

I'm a little indifferent about the location. There's a small parking lot and additional street parking, so if it's busy, you might have to drive around to find some parking like we did. Even so, we found a street parking spot within 5 minutes, so it's not really a hassle. 

Inside Vesta, you can see how it appeals to a younger, more hip crown. It's modern, and the decor is clean and bright. Usually, you'll see people working on their laptops or just meeting up. The seating is slightly limited because they have their roaster in the back which takes up a lot of space. Seating isn't a huge problem unless you happen to come in during a big rush, but overall, the seating is pretty good.
Great coffee! A good latte does not need any additives, and Vesta did not disappoint.
First time here, cool vibe, friendly staff, good tea.  Here for a meeting so I didn't eat, but the menu looks on pointe.  I'll be back!

Quick summary: The best cup of pure coffee you'll have in Vegas

If you are a coffee aficionado, you'll appreciate the attention to detail Vesta applies to their drip.  First off, as their name implies, they roast on site, which is an art in itself.  Their grind size is on point and looks like they use ChemEx (or similar) glass dripper.  Everything in the establishment is clean (clean is good).  I watched the person making my coffee and noticed he let the grinds 'bloom' first before pouring more hot water (in a spiral motion).  I consider this a more advanced move and unexpected from an retail place where queues can get long.  All of these small details results in a superb cup of coffee.
Wonderful range of home roasted coffee blends. Nice atmosphere away from the tourist traps :) Highly recommend the flat white on Goosebumps. Friendly and talkative staff

Nice Coffee shop located at DTLV. 
Venue was spacious and service was warm and friendly.

I ordered matcha latte, which was goood. I was expecting more of a stronger matcha taste. But overall, the presentation was on point great coffee flavour and was delicious. Pricey but it was well worth it...
Great coffee and customer service. Their food hits the spot and the setting is comfortable but has a nice working environment.
Very minimalist coffee shop.  I had the cold brew and it was good.  There's parking so that's good too.  It's a nice place for coffee and to get some work done too.

They've actually taken care of all the little things. It's such a great vibe. It's very modern/trendy but still has a particularly local feel. It's got an authentic Vegas-style that I can't quite describe but really like. Of course the coffee is great. And food choices good. I also wanna give props to everyone who works here. The service is consistently hospitable and chill. All around a two thumbs up!!

I'm just floored, in the best way, this place in gorgeous inside, spacious, its what intelligentsia cafes try for. The food options all sounded delicious, some standards with a lovely twist on it. Two outstanding vegan options, the chia oats are the perfect breakfast, super filling; I haven't tried the avocado toast yet, but I will soon.

I also got a pour over, the Ethiopia, just delicious, smooth, perfect brew.

The staff was on their toes, fulfilling all the orders, but with smiles.

This is the coffee shop 18b needed, its spacious, but inviting. Its has the right space if you need to bang out a paper powered by some espresso, but there is also the right space to meet with a friend over a cup of coffee and have a conversation. Welcome to the neighborhood!
Was feeling under the weather so thought a turmeric latte would do the trick. I got it sweet and greatly enjoyed it. Also ordered the chia pudding with bananas.

A total gem in the midst of a desert.

Vesta, what are you doing in Vegas?! Move to California. I know a ton of people who would love ya.

Amazing coffee and good food is a rare thing to find together in a small coffee roaster.

Try the macadamia nut almond latte if you want something dairy free. It's not your typical flavored latte with syrups - they use almond and macadamia nut milk! 

The matcha latte is expensive, but high quality. Rich and full.

My favorite was the breakfast sandwich - imagine an egg mc muffin made by Gordon Ramsay. 

Avo toast was standard, you can't go wrong that classic.

Go to Vesta - they're amazing!
This new space is phenomenal on multiple levels: stellar coffee, gorgeous interiors and outstanding service! One of my new favorite local spots! Highly recommend!

good coffee and food. 
great for meet up but not with babies konda place...has an urban feel-like...cute merchandise...over all i love the place

Best breakfast sandwhich, ugh so good. I also had the matcha tea latte and it was just the right amount of creaminess and bitterness. Like how open and big the space is. Also the parking is really easy.

This was our first stop after landing in LAS because Jeff V recommended this place to Nadine C. When deciding where to go, this place stood out because they have croissants and Mink loves croissants. As long as they had coffee, I was good. Surprisingly the latte they made was legit. It was a lot better than I expected and started off my morning on a positive note. 

When you enter, you'll notice the modern decor and the pallets of coffee beans in the back. You totally get the hipster vibe in here. There is ample natural light from the windows and side clear garage door. You can see straight into their private lot. That was my favorite aspect of the decor there and I definitely loved the ambiance. They also have clean gender neutral restrooms. 

Customer service here was friendly and they bring your orders to you. Mink ordered the Ham and Cheese with a Cappuccino. Nadine and I shared a Vesta Breakfast Sandwich and a Truffle Croissant Sandwich. They were very good and I don't really care for croissants. It's probably my favorite croissant place that I've been to. Thank you Jeff V for recommending this spot and thank you Nadine C for driving us there! Awesome way to start Mink's first trip to Vegas.

This was by far our best coffee experience in Vegas. We just moved here a week ago and have been all of the top rated places. The employees were great atmosphere good and the coffee was awesome. My sister in law ordered a "golden milk" (?) I think that is what it was called. Super good too. We will be back this week to try the food

This place is so refreshing. It has a nice atmosphere, plenty of seating, and great service. My friend and I tried the Vesta Breakfast Sandwhich and the Truffle Croissant. For drinks, a coffee pour from one of their unique roasted coffees and the Anxi Wulong tea. Everything was delicious. The coffee had a lot of notes - this one with plum, chocolate, caramel - and the tea was flowery and light. We were still sipping our drinks after the savory food was devoured so we also tried the Milk & Honey toast for dessert. Also delicious! One of my new favorite coffee spots.

My husband picked up some coffee from Vesta the other day when he was downtown. I love fresh roasted beans! Made our first pot of coffee and will definitely be back to get more beans. Delicious, well-balanced and fresh flavor.

This is my go-to coffee place in Las Vegas.

Fantastic coffee options and great customer service. I came here and tried their Ethiopia pour-over and was very impressed with my coffee. The decor and vibe of this place is great. There's ample table/counter space. While I didn't order it, I did notice that they have Nitro Cold Brew and Regular Cold Brew. I will definitely be coming back.
Great coffee, great food. A little place in downtown Las Vegas. My dearest got their special Mocha-twice-he liked it that much. It's a little ways off the strip, but well worth the trip!

Once again, I was in the area so I wanted to take advantage and try something new and I happened to stumble upon Vesta, and found out that it was close to a few other places that I have previously tried! It's the downtown art district so unsurprisingly this coffee shop was very hipster. I walked in and there were quite a bit of people, it seemed like there was some kind of event happening? But because of that, I felt like the staff was a bit more distracted than probably usual. In fact, because of the busy atmosphere with people walking around everywhere, it almost felt more like a bar than a coffee shop. The menu hosts a variety of different treats, drinks, etc, and everything I tried was wonderful! I had the matcha latte($6) and the ham and cheese croissant($5); the matcha latte had quality matcha in it and they gave you the option to sweeten it which was nice. The ham and cheese croissant was perfectly simple: a quality butter croissant with ham and gruyere...so delicious! It's a little on the expensive side, but it's for good ingredients and well-crafted drinks.

Easily one of my top 3 coffee spots in Vegas, with Makers & Finders and Sunrise Coffee. I love that they do offer vegan options, especially their housemade macadamia almond milk. The inside is very spacious and simple in decor. Overall, the food and drinks are yummy, but the service needs some work still. 

The first time I came here, I asked the cashier for her recommendation so I ended up getting the Vesta breakfast sandwich without meat ($7), and today I just realized that's the exact same thing as the cheese & egg sandwich ($5) just $2 more! The cashier should have just told me to get the cheese & egg sandwich! I'm going to assume just that one employee isn't up to par. After a month of being open, I feel that all staff should know all of the menu items, especially since there aren't that many. Also today, I was told that the only sweetener they had was simple syrup by the cashier. After I sat down with my latte, I asked another employee that was walking around and she clarified that they DO have honey! Again, maybe some employees just need more training. 

I wish they had more coffee choices/flavors, but maybe that's coming in the future? Hopefully! I have tried their matcha latte with nut milk and their macadamia almond latte. Both were very good and recommendable. The breakfast sandwich and their avocado toast were great as well. I'm not sure what kind of bun it is that they use on their sandwiches, but it's fluffy and flavorful...almost addicting. I really do want this place to succeed, and will continue to support it's growth by trying everything on the menu!

So my co-worker and I were staying at the Hilton on Paradise for a convention and were in desperate need of non-Starbucks coffee. We also needed a break from the loud gaudy Vegas scene. I found this location on Yelp and gave it a try.  We were pleasantly surprised with this coffee shop. They roast their own and have some tasty breakfast treats. The interior is minimalist and the staff super friendly. It is a wide open modern interior but very comfortable. Lots of local regulars and a few interesting characters to keep it authentic. I could easily see myself being a fixture at this coffee shop.

I enjoyed the Aztec mocha (double shot, half of normal amount of chocolate with almond milk) and breakfast sandwich three days in a row. Absolutely delicious. I would go back in an instant the next time I am in town. The only reason I am giving them a four instead of a five is because they need to pull their espresso a little longer. It is a bit on the sour side. Beyond that little mis-step they are awesome.
