Navigation tip - head north from the Stratosphere and turn left at Charleston, go down a few blocks and it is on the left by a metal torch statue thing. Google maps had us on a Lord of the RIngs adventure through all the side streets.

Wow! Amazing coffee! Vesta Coffee Roasters is brand new to the downtown Vegas area. 
Let's start with their menu. I love the coffee and tea options they offer. The coffee is fresh and made correctly. I've been digging their Cortado. Also, the food menu looks excellent. I haven't tried the food yet, but what I saw come out looked tasty. The food menu has great twists on toasts and sandwiches. 
I like the minimalistic atmosphere Vesta offers. Plain walls and just some tables and chairs. I thought it was neat that they have a bar you can sit and watch the people and traffic go by. Definitely sets the tone for an awesome experience. You can also watch them roast the coffee beans right there. The staff is helpful and full of knowledge about coffee. No wonder their coffee is so good. Great coffee, relaxing atmosphere and a sweet staff make Vesta Coffee Roasters a wonderful new spot downtown.

They sold us a bag of beans roasted March 20 on April 6 (17 days old). Any self-respecting roastery would rotate in fresh beans after 2 weeks, but we couldn't even check the "Roasted on" dates on the bags because they keep the beans locked away in a glass case and they had to pull it out for us. The line was long, so we opted not to have them check the dates before we bought them, then forgot until we'd already left. Disappointing discovery, to say the least.

In addition, their nitro cold brew ($1 extra) went flat almost immediately after walking out the door. I've never experienced that before. Of course the bubbles dissipate, but it shouldn't happen that fast.

#280:
Very good SOE The place is coffee first, although they've got a healthy menu of vittles. The barista was extremely dialed in, as was the espresso.

I ordered through Postmates today and we enjoyed everything but the miso mint ceaser salad. I'm  thinking maybe it doesn't travel that great. The egg had no yoak and was slimy like snot. The lettuce was wilted and the water from the poached egg kind of made the salad soupy. It was very disappointing and I just wanted to give heads up in case anyone was going to order it for delivery. I'll definitely give it a try again when I dine in though. The turkey tumatillo soup was absolutely delicious!
Great coffee ! Excellent service and atmosphere. Wide variety of pastries and different things to eat. I had a cappuccino and the ham and cheese croissant and they were both awesome.
This place is super cute... I only took coffee to go. The coffee was great, would love to try the food next time :) Tons of Millennials and very trendy.
The barista was very personable and the nitro cold brew was the best of the several that I've tried in Vegas.

Great place to hang out and get work done. The staff is very friendly and a lot of the clientele is "artsy." The coffee is very good, although a little pricey for my taste, nonetheless, I highly recommend it.

Oh my word, I just love and adore this place. We were in town for a wedding and doing the low-key thing. Trusty Yelp pointed us in this direction and it's now one of my favorite places ever and will be a must-stop on my next trip to Vegas. 

Parking: plenty of parking in the private lot, some street parking. The neighborhood appears to be in transformation and I loved the architectural details popping up. The bar across the street definitely has some cool details. 

Ambience: super chill, low key. This is a place you can comfortably work at and also have a good time catching up with friends. The space is laid out very nicely with room to spare. I found myself wishing for a cozy armchair but then I'd fall asleep and maybe they don't want that hahaha! The customer service is also beyond! They're really attentive, warm and friendly. This is definitely the neighborhood vibe we all want to experience. 

Food/Drink: completely on point! I had the hazelnut latte and it was delicious. I also tried the avocado toast which was on Tartine bread and you know how we SFers get down for our bread. My fave thing though was the ham/cheese croissant galette. I could eat that everyday. They also have fruit infused water available. My friends and I loved everything we ate and drank.
My favorite place to get coffee. If you really need a pic me up, try the Nitro, it keeps me going for hrs. The food is great as well!

The coffee is amazing, the service is great and the vibe is casual and relaxed - perfect for the neighborhood.

But what's up with the lack of desserts?  Coffee and dessert are yin and yang.  But every time I've been here, there is really nothing for dessert. 

To the Owners :  You have created a great space.  Partner with a local bakery and give us something to satisfy our sweet tooth.  It's been MONTHS!

I made all that is fake and debauchery in Las Vegas there stands a coffee roaster that brings warmth and positive artistic sensibilities to the city. I haven for artists and writers poets and thinkers. This place is a must. Vesta coffee roasters strives to bring the civility and peace to an otherwise insane town.

First time but won't be the last. I'm impressed, not just with the excellent latte but with the experience. 

It's a bit industrial but also eclectic being in the Arts District. 

The latte was very smooth. The shot was definitely well roasted but not bitter at all. They know how to roast. The milk was steamed and poured right. Very well done. 

Simple table and chair set up. Perfect for meetings and gatherings if you need a place downtown.

I'll be back for sure when I'm in the area and need a great coffee or other espresso based drink.

Vesta is amazing! I moved to Vegas from Seattle where I developed a taste and passion for fine espresso. You can pretty much find a coffee shop with well trained baristas on every corner in seattle so I came here with high expectations. Went to several sub par coffee shops in the area until I found this little gem. The atmosphere 5, people and staff 5, coffee 5, talent of baristas 5. The only reason I gave them 4 stars overall is because they don't have soy milk and I realize this is a purist thing to do but I have dietary restrictions. Also they don't have punch cards or reward system. Also place is not very kid friendly if you come with children. What made up for it was when I brought in my toddler Tyler made up a drink that was not on the menu for my little guy. Thanks Tyler!

When I walk in to a coffee shop and they don't know what a cortado is, I usually walk out. I came to Vesta and asked for a Gibraltar and they made it with perfection.

There's also tons of parking in front and they have their own parking lot

Vesta is a gem. Quality food and coffee drinks, careful precision and care when it comes to the product, and several amazing people from the Vegas coffee scene work here now. It's like a Vegas coffee all star game in there! Welcome to to the neighborhood and cheers to your success!

WOW!!!  Locally roasted coffee beans? Uh....yes, ma'am!  So Cesar Q. and I were running errands downtown and swung by Donut Bar for a latte and of course, a donut.  To my surprise, the espresso/coffee served there is from none other than Vesta!!

What the....!?!  Beans are roasted on property?!  I love supporting local retailers and these beans are bomb.com!!  They are perfectly roasted, somewhat mild, not overly dark or burnt tasting like that "star..." place.  

Vesta has a nice selection of drinks and food to choose from.  We were only here to buy a few pounds of beans for home and to get yet another iced latte.  I can't talk specifically on the food.  What I can say is that the menu options looked great!  They had a corn chowder for the soup of the day...looked YUM to me!

There is plenty of parking out front and a dedicated parking lot that was full just to the south of the coffee shop.  Vesta is located off Charleston and Casino Center.  Lots of seating inside too!  Staff was genuinely friendly and outgoing.  I can't wait to swing by for lunch one of these days!

Love finding spots like this.  The coffee/espresso is great and by the looks of it, the food is too!

Everything is good! Coffee, food, staff! And locations! Comfortable place I love it! 
???????????????????????????????????(*-*)

The Yelp Book Club had its first meeting of 2017 here at Vesta on Saturday. 

This spot was chosen because: 
1.  I'd seen photos of the Matcha Latte, and was dying to try it.
2.  They have vegan options.
3. Location, Location, Location.

I'm torn on the rating to give Vesta...I keep switching from 3 to 4, and back to three stars.  
I think for now, I'm going to stick  with 4, because besides a few minor inconveniences, I really enjoyed my visit.

So first and foremost: HUGE props to the place for having parking that is not metered.  The parking lot is a little small, but we were able to park with no issue. 

Vesta is a cute spot, Its extremely minimalist in decor, which is kind of a "meh" for me.  The chairs aren't comfortable.  If you're on the fluffier side of the spectrum, they're a little small.  They do have high stools though, but those aren't super comfy either.   There isn't a ton of seating...but the vibe here is good.   

The employees were super upbeat, and friendly.  I had questions about a couple of the items, and got answers with no attitude or anything.  

They roast on site, which I love.  I didn't try their house coffee this time, but definitely plan to go back again to try a pour over or two, and maybe even pick up a bag of beans.  

The drinks are made without sweeteners, so if you want sugar/stevia, you'll have to ask to have the drink sweetened.  If its not sweetened to your liking, there is a station with packets so you can sweeten to your own taste.

The menu isn't overwhelming, which I like a lot.  Like the decor, its pretty minimalist, but even being a small menu, there's something for everyone, and a lot of variety. 

This visit we tried: 
Matcha Latte:  Culinary grade matcha with whole milk:  this was really good.  Something about matcha makes me think of freshly mown grass, but only the aroma.  The flavor is delicious, and super refreshing.  I'm not usually one for tea lattes, but I liked this a lot.  Latte art was on point!  I had asked for sweetener, and found it a little under sweet for my taste, but I really like that...they don't add a ton of sugar to your drink.  It didn't need too much more to be the way I wanted it.    

Aztec Hot Chocolate: This was awesome.  Raw cacao with whole milk and chile, mmmmm.  Spicy and delicious.  I don't know if my fella got it sweetened or not, but it was delicious.  

"All the Things":  An everything bagel, but instead of a bagel, its a croissant!  Buttery.  Delicious.  Served with a house made "fromage blanc"...which in French is white cheese, but this was more like an unsalted butter...maybe it had cheese in it?  Like a cream cheese?  Either way, it was really good.  Delicious. 

My partners in books both got the avocado toast, one with a poached egg on top.  It looked amazing.  I didn't get to try it due to my allergy, but...seriously, this is a sexy dish.  

All in all, it was a good experience.  I definitely want to come back to try some of their house roasted coffee, and some more of the food offerings.

Another great addition to the Arts District. I'm sad that I haven't come sooner. Just walking into the smell alone deserves a star of its own. It has a vet open, bright environment. Very simple in its design, but put together in a very attractive, communal sort of way. The music is A+, by the way. 

I came in for the Macadamia Nut Latte, but was sad I didn't come with an appetite. My coffee was delicious, lightly sweetened, as requested. The espresso was the star of the drink, very smooth, yet present in the drink. The macadamia was more of a complimenting flavor, and a great one at that. 

My friend ordered an egg sandwich that was dripping syrup. I almost ordered one, even though I was full from breakfast still. It looked amazing, and my friend practically inhaled it, he liked it so much. 

I'm coming back.

The area badly needed a place with this much polish. Gorgeous buildout, and an EXCELLENT small breakfast menu. Food was priced fairly, not over priced, (which is rare for downtown places that think they can get away with exhorbitant pricing because it's a redevelopment area (I'm talking to you, Eat & MTO cafe) solid 7 days open. Looking forward to going again. Only thing, the service could have been a little more attentive / friendlier.
Stopped here on a road trip and got the hazelnut latte. This is the best tasting latte I have ever had in my entire life! I hope to come back here next time I am in Vegas!
Vesta is worth the bus ride out of the strip. I love the avocado on toast, the coffee and the chia/oats. Would happily come back here for every breakfast in Vegas!

Dope spot past outlets DTLV had spicy hot cocoa with friends after lunch!   Cool little super mod spot!   Love it!  Totally hipster!  Staff was awesome!   Thanks Guys!!!  I wish u had more choices for peeps who like flavors in coffee and such!  I'll still totally finback when down at that end of DTLV!
Great place for coffee, I work down the street so it's my go to. Big fan of their spam sandwich and cold brews.

Tons of parking! 
Enjoyed a piping hot and wonderfully flavorful Americano. The atmosphere is crisp, clean and comfortable. Lots of good seating, a community table, and lots of natural light. Service was fast, and the food looks like it's made with love. Looking forward to trying a bite next time. I will definitely be back soon!

Wow my new top spot in Vegas for coffee. Loved the chill vibe here, nice staff and varied menu. I had the homemade macadamian nut milk latte and surprisingly was delicious. Also had a perfect avocado toast and egg and cheese sandwich. The maple syrup on the egg and cheese was a different and unique twist but we didn't hate it! Reminds me of your small local place but the word is getting out and they are filling up now on weekends! Get in here now before the rush!

Coffee shops are my favorite places to try out & the aesthetic of Vesta always makes me eager to come back to try their coffees every time!  

The atmosphere of the place just screams hip with its modern interior vibes and numerous spherical lamps, which I absolutely adore about the place. It's a great study area with its numerous amount of seatings and they also offer some food (even vegan friendly options) to enjoy with your drink. 

COFFEE: Their macadamia almond milk latte is great but for the past few times I've tried it, the coffee flavor isn't very pronounced which I look for in my coffee. I did really enjoy the hazelnut latte that comes with rosemary maple syrup and would love to come back to order it again. The coffees are a bit overpriced considering the size you get them - $5-6 for a small 12 oz cup. They also have a small merchandise section of coffee beans and even clothing! 

Overall, a definite try if you find yourself in the Arts District!

This place was acceptable. The reviews make it seem like it's coffee heaven. We had their egg sandwiches they were Pretty tasty with a bit of a honey taste. Not overwhelming sweet. The meals were pretty good with some chips on the side. We also tried a Caramel machiatto and a berry cascara. The Machiatto was authentic and very good. The cascara was really gross with the peppery aftertaste. I believe the berries were previously frozen because they seemed a little slimy. The decor in the coffee shop is cute with a cog fee roaster, coffee bags, and vintage art that has been repainted.  The staff is very friendly.

Yet another great coffee option in LV...Ham and Cheese croissant and macadamia almond latte were both good, I liked the décor and vibe of the place except they could use a few more seats...free parking makes a quick stop possible...

The latest and greatest coffee spot to open in Vegas is Vesta Coffee.
Open less than a month, accolades for this new business have been pouring in as quickly as the lattes, teas, and nitro cold brews served up here.  
Located in a bright, open space on Casino Center off of Charleston, Vesta also offers pastries, toasts, and sandwiches.  After two visits, I have had and can recommend the Milk & Honey toast with house Fromage Blanc, honey, and cinnamon, the matcha latte, and the popular macadamia-almond latte with house-made nut milk.  Baristas Michelle and May are super friendly and create some lovely drinks that also taste fabulous.
This is definitely worth the trip downtown and we'll be making it often.

Excellent coffee and breakfast selection!!! Loved this gem and will be back for sure. They know their craft and make an excellent cup. I had a ristretto americano and my husband had their cold brew. Breakfast was delicious. I had the avocado toast with a poached egg and my husband had the bacon egg and cheese sandwich.

This coffee shop is....expensive....but very tasty. The decor is super hipster and modern. They proudly display their coffee roasting equipment. I tried two of their specialty coffee drinks, with their special orange coffee being more delicious than their more well known hazelnut latte. Both were made well and generally tasty. I would return!

Do yourself a favor and try the absolute best coffee in Vegas at Vesta! They have an amazing menu with fresh food selections and delicious specialty drinks that never taste too sugary. Even their classic coffees have the best rich flavors. Vesta also roasts their own beans in the back and sells bagged beans from many different regions worldwide. Also a fun ambiance in the heart of downtown Vegas that attracts a colorful crowd. All the baristas are great, especially Michelle! She knows all of our usual group by name and always makes a point to stop and chat with me about life. Get down here and you'll see why this is the best coffee shop to meet friends or work for hours drinking endless coffees and munching on avocado toast.

Super cool little coffee shop in downtown Vegas. They do all their roasting of the beans in house and the smell it creates throughout is outstanding. I tried the Nitro Cold Brew, its dark deep and rich.. similar consistency and taste of a Guinness. My girlfriend ordered the macadamia latte which was very good not overly sweet and had a nice nutty taste to it though not overpowering nice and subtle hint.. for food we got the ham and cheese croissant which was super tasty, nice thick pieces of ham with a good ratio of greuyere cheese, the dough was nice and flaky. We also got the vesta breakfast sandwich, the bread was awesome had a croissant taste to it which I loved and the eggs were perfectly cooked and fluffy, the kicker was the maple syrup they add on the sandwich which topped it off nicely with a bit of sweetness. Check this place out if you get a chance.. perfect place to hang out and enjoy some coffee.

We were here yesterday as part of Vegas Valley Food Tours.  I love this place!  The interior is airy and light and beautiful.  I had an ice hazelnut latte.  Really, really good.  Would love another one.  Met the owner, a super friendly, nice guy.  Very, very impressed with this place and will be back.

Best cold brew in Vegas. Seriously, it's delicious. 

The pour over coffee is also very flavorful, and the food is yummy. I love the oats and the ham and cheese croissant. Can't go wrong with either choice. 

They were also super helpful when I needed cold brew to go for a brunch. Coffee, creamer (dairy and non dairy), and sweetener all ready to go. It was a huge hit at brunch!

Great place to go and work or hang out--they have a decent amount of seating, and the tables are solidly built. Outlets are a scarce commodity. The latte is solid, not the best I've had but good, as is the coffee, though the coffee is also on the pricey side. One of the better coffeeshops in Vegas.

Very friendly service and the cold brew was super tasty. Good breakfast options and quick snacks that are filling! I love the atmosphere here as well, felt comfortable to sit and chat over coffee while waiting for my food. I can't wait to come back here and oogle the cute pins for sale up front.
the Avocado toast was everything I'd hoped it would be. Great latte too. Will be back.
Great coffee, I had the Macadamia-Almond Latte with Hawaiian Egg Benedict sandwich. Love the atmosphere here.

Amazing atmosphere and just an all around awesome place to grab a coffee and chill! Friendly and knowledgeable staff that go above and beyond! I might be biased because I live right across the street yet I go to do many other spots around the whole of Vegas, Henderson and Summerlin and this still is hands down my favorite spot. Love the smell of the freshly roasted coffee beans all times of the day!

A nice place away from the Vegas chaos. A local friend of mine recomended this place as one of his favs. The neighborhood seemes a little ghetto but that could just be me. There was plenty of parking near by for us and the line was pretty short mid day. Would highly recommend coming over and trying the cold brew.

I went here to receive a tarot card reading by Heather Grace (she's amazing, by the way!) And is has all the makings you could want for an urban coffee shop in the heart of Downtown Las Vegas. 

I was a little concerned driving in because parking is limited to a small lot behind the building (half of which are reserved for apartment owners and other businesses) and the street spots, while free, were being utilized for an "Antique Car Show Sunday" Show. But, I arrived just before 9am and by 10am, those cars were cleared. And on the plus side, all this parking is FREE. 

Since it is impolite to touch tarot cards with greasy hands, I opted not to order food, but Heather got an egg and cheese muffin that truly looked like gourmet cheesy goodness. 

This is definitely the kind of place where every barista will know your name! Additionally, there is a decent amount of seating and plenty of space between the tables, so if you're coming here to get work down, you've got room to spread out! 

The floors are concrete, so even if it gets noisy, it doesn't usually get too "loud."
Good place for local hanging out. Little pricey.. four people with coffee and sandwich came to $40. Nice place though.

Coolest coffeehouse in Vegas! One of my colleagues picked Vesta for our Staff Meeting on Wednesday morning. We rotate every second Wednesday of the month, some body picks their fav. Charles scored with this! Love the vibe, ordering area, laptop pluggable, parking adjacent, (don't have to pay for street parking), baristas are friendly and accommodating with all my questions. One of the owners came by to check in, how's it going, what did you like. He REALLY cares about his customers experience. And I must say, it IS an experience. I will be back!

Love it!  Can't wait to return.  Great lattes and friendly staff.   

And lots of delicious high-quality breakfast goodies like the salmon on Ricotta toast with dill that I'm enjoying!

I seek this place out every time!

Rolled in on a weekday morning. And when I say rolled in, I mean it. I literally rolled out of bed, threw on some yoga pants and a bulky sweater, rocked a top knot, and made my way in to post up and get some work done. There is some street parking right in front and a little side lot. Very convenient for people like me who love the luxury of working from a cafe, but despise the two hour parking limits or paid parking all about the city.

The decor inside is sleek and simple. Tables, bar tops, roaster in the back. It's like coffee heaven. They have a variety of teas and espresso drinks that will satisfy almost any craving for caffeine. The staff is eclectic, cool, and very kind. I heard them welcome nearly every guest by name, so it's clear that they take great care of strangers and regulars alike. It was my first time in, and I was guided through their hot tea selections with great care. I ordered a pot of their herbal tea (forgive me, but I don't recall what she said the name was) because I wanted something calming. I received their wi-fi password and dove straight into work.

Vesta has a steady stream of guests coming and going, so people watching is a major plus of the location. I opted to stay for several hours so I ended up heading back to the counter for an order of their soup of the day, Vegetable Chili with toast. The chili was full of a variety of beans and the toast was browned just enough to add crunch and sprinkled with a light dusting of white crumbled cheese.

I'm already planning my next morning to post up and get caffeinated. .

We had pour overs El Salvador Ethiopian and I forget the other but they were all distinctive and well prepared. The environment is open casual and comfortable. This little arts district is peaceful and uncrowded off the strip and walking distance to downtown. 

Looking forward to returning on next visit.

If you are looking for a creamy, smooth espresso drink, this is the place to come. I live in Nashville where independent coffee shops outnumber Starbucks, and it is taken very seriously. Vesta can absolutely compete with my top 2 in Nashville. I will come again next time I'm in Vegas. Oh!  And get the breakfast tacos if they are the special of the day. So delicious!!!

Good coffee and delicious breakfast sandwiches. The staff is friendly, and the location has a good amount of space for hanging out or working.

One downside is the smell. They don't have hoods over their cook station, and their windows aren't always open, so the place smells of grease and smoke. The smell stays on my clothes every time I leave. 

If they could get the air circulation handled, this would probably be a regular stop on our Vegas trips!
